alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Eastern Clay; Eastern Putnam; Inland St. Johns; Union; Western Clay; Western Putnam (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Bradford, northeastern Alachua, St. Johns, northern Putnam, eastern Union and Clay Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 800 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Sampson to near Bostwick. Movement was southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, pea size hail, excessive cloud-to-ground lightning, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Excessive cloud-to-ground lightning is occurring. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Saint Augustine, Palatka, Green Cove Springs, Starke, Lake Butler, Interlachen, Keystone Heights, Hastings and Raiford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Eastern Clay; Eastern Putnam; Inland St. Johns; Union; Western Clay; Western Putnam
